conclusion: Identify the known quantities: Mass of the ball (M), Mass of the bullet (m), Height of the table (h), Horizontal distance from the landing point of the ping-pong ball to the edge of the table (s)
Understand the scenario: The ball is loaded and cocked in the toy gun, The bullet is fired from the gun, The bullet enters the hole in the ball and is ejected horizontally along with the ball
Kinematic equations: The horizontal motion of the ball and the bullet can be described by the kinematic equations x = v_0t and y = 1/2gt^2
Set up the equations: The ball is on the edge of the table, so its initial vertical position is h, The bullet is ejected horizontally, so its initial vertical position is 0

Determine the initial velocity: The bullet is ejected horizontally, so its initial velocity in the horizontal direction is v_0, The bullet is ejected vertically, so its initial velocity in the vertical direction is 0
Use the kinematic equations: The horizontal motion of the ball and the bullet can be described by the equations x = v_0t and y = 1/2gt^2

Solve for the initial velocity: The initial vertical position of the ball is h, so we have h = 1/2gt^2, The initial vertical position of the bullet is 0, so we have 0 = 1/2gt^2, Solving for t gives t = sqrt(2h/g)
Substituting t into the horizontal motion equation gives x = v_0sqrt(2h/g)
Final velocity: The exit velocity of the bullet can be expressed in terms of the measured quantities as v = sqrt(2gh)
